briefdescription.para: Function returning the current position of the source body.
Function returning the current cone angle of the target body.
Function returning the current clock angle of the target body.
Current cone angle of the body (in rad).
Current clock angle of the body (in rad).
Front emissivity coefficient of the target body.
Back emissivity coefficient of the target body.
Front Lambertian coefficient of the target body.
Back Lambertian coefficient of the target body.
Reflectivity coefficient of the target body.
Specular reflection coefficient of the target body.
Function returning the velocity of the central body.
Current vector of the target's normalised velocity.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::function< double() > sourcePower, const std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() > sourcePositionFunction, const std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() > targetPositionFunction, const std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() > targetVelocityFunction, const double area, const std::function< double(const double) > coneAngle, const std::function< double(const double) > clockAngle, const double frontEmissivityCoefficient, const double backEmissivityCoefficient, const double frontLambertianCoefficient, const double backLambertianCoefficient, const double reflectivityCoefficient, const double specularReflectionCoefficient, const std::vector< std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() > > occultingBodyPositions=std::vector< std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() > >(), const std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() > centralBodyVelocity=std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() >(), const std::vector< double > occultingBodyRadii=std::vector< double >(), const double sourceRadius=0.0)
memberdef.name: SolarSailingRadiationPressureInterface

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para:
Class constructor for radiation pressure interface (appropriate for solar sail model)
sourcePower
Function returning the current total power (in W) emitted by the source body.
sourcePositionFunction
Function returning the current position of the source body.
targetPositionFunction
Function returning the current position of the target body.
targetVelocityFunction
Function returning the current velocity of the target body w.r.t. central body.
area
Reflecting area of the target body.
coneAngle
Function returning the current cone angle of the target body.
clockAngle
Function returning the current clock angle of the target body.
frontEmissivityCoefficient
Front emissivity coefficient of the target body.
backEmissivityCoefficient
Back emissivity coefficient of the target body.
frontLambertianCoefficient
Front Lambertian coefficient of the target body.
backLambertianCoefficient
Back Lambertian coefficient of the target body.
reflectivityCoefficient
Reflectivity coefficient of the target body.
specularReflectionCoefficient
Specular reflection coefficient of the target body.
occultingBodyPositions
List of functions returning the positions of the bodies causing occultations (default none) NOTE: Multiple concurrent occultations may currently result in slighlty underestimted radiation pressure.
centralBodyVelocity
Function returning the current velocity of the central body.
occultingBodyRadii
List of radii of the bodies causing occultations (default none).
sourceRadius
Radius of the source body (used for occultation calculations) (default 0).

briefdescription.para: Base class function to update the current properties of the solar sailing radiation pressure acceleration model.

detaileddescription.para:
Base class function to update the current properties of the solar sailing radiation pressure acceleration model. This function is nominally called by the updateInterface function, which may be overridden by derived classes.
currentTime
Time at which acceleration model is to be updated.

briefdescription.para: Class in which the properties of a solar sailing radiation pressure acceleration model are stored.

detaileddescription.para: Class in which the properties of a solar sailing radiation pressure acceleration model are stored and in which the current solar sailing radiation pressure is calculated based on the source power and geometry, as well as on the spacecraft solar sail model.
